channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Only one in 3 U.S. adults approve of the way Trump is managing the government, AP-NORC poll shows
item.description: The approval rating decline was driven in large part by Republicans and independents, the survey found.

item.title: Anthropic says new $50B investment in data centers will create about 800 permanent jobs and 2,400 construction jobs
item.description: The tech industry is moving forward investments to build energy-hungry AI infrastructure, despite bubble concerns.

item.title: Israel Reopens Gaza Aid Route It Had Closed for Months
item.description: The cease-fire with Hamas has blunted the hunger faced by Gazans during the war. But aid agencies say Israeli restrictions are still hobbling their wo...

item.title: City Council Approves Plan That Could Bring 14,700 Homes to Queens
item.description: The New York plan would open up 54 blocks of Long Island City, which are mostly warehouses and parking lots, to housing.

item.title: When will I know if my flight is canceled? Here’s what to expect as delays ripple across U.S. airports
item.description: Things will return to normal, eventually, but in time for Thanksgiving travel? That's not a given at this point.

item.title: The U.S. Mint ended production of the penny, citing cost savings and the coin’s fading relevance as its buying power—once enough for a snack or candy—has all but disappeared
item.description: “God bless America, and we’re going to save the taxpayers $56 million,” U.S. Treasurer Brandon Beach said just before hitting a button to strike the f...

item.title: Epstein email says Trump ‘knew about the girls’ as White House calls its release a Democratic smear
item.description: Democrats released emails referencing Trump, including a 2011 Epstein note saying Trump spent hours at his home with a sex trafficking victim.

item.title: California Rain Forecast Suddenly Intensifies, Raising Flooding Risks
item.description: The storm is expected to move quickly through Northern California by Thursday morning, but forecasters are concerned that it will stall in the souther...

item.title: Epstein Bantered Regularly With Larry Summers
item.description: The former Treasury secretary corresponded routinely with Jeffrey Epstein. In one series of exchanges, he sought Mr. Epstein’s advice on how to handle...

item.title: Chess Grandmaster Faces Ethics Complaint After Death of Daniel Naroditsky
item.description: The International Chess Federation filed the complaint against Vladimir Kramnik, a former world champion who had insinuated that Daniel Naroditsky che...

item.title: Algeria Pardons Writer Boualem Sansal at Germany’s Request
item.description: Boualem Sansal, an Algerian-French writer, was arrested on accusations of undermining national security during a visit to his homeland a year ago and ...

item.title: South Asia on Edge
item.description: There are no known links between two bomb attacks in India and Pakistan, but they come as tensions between the countries are already high.

item.title: How to Capture the Northern Lights With Just Your Smartphone
item.description: Modern cellphone cameras make it easy to capture the famously fickle Aurora Borealis.

item.title: Israel Reopens Gaza Aid Route It Had Closed for Months

item.title: Russia’s First A.I. Humanoid Robot Crashes Into the Tech Scene
item.description: AIDOL, Russia’s first AI humanoid robot, collapsed onstage moments after its unveiling at a technology event in Moscow on Tuesday.
